title: Centro Desportivo Universitário de Lisboa
text:
Centro Desportivo Universitário de Lisboa, or CDUL, is a Portuguese <a href="multisports%20club">multisports club</a> originally created for <a href="Lisbon">Lisbon</a>'s university students that evolved into a club for all ages, its prime sport being rugby. CDUL is the most decorated Portuguese <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> team and was represented by four players at the <a href="2007%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2007 Rugby World Cup</a> finals. In 31/01/14 the senior rugby team won the 2014 main championship title after defeating GD Direito 19-15 While studying <a href="economics">economics</a>, the former Prime Minister and President of the Republic of Portugal <a href="An%C3%ADbal%20Cavaco%20Silva">Aníbal Cavaco Silva</a> was an athlete of CDUL <a href="athletics%20%28sport%29">athletics</a> department from 1958 to 1963.
On 6 January 2013, CDUL defeated <a href="Valladolid%20RAC">Quesos Entrepinares</a> by 24–13, winning their third Iberic Cup.
